name: JCR
body:
### Overview
JSON Content Rules (JCR), a language for
describing and testing the interchange of data in JSON [RFC7159]
format used by computer protocols and processes.  The syntax of JCR
is not JSON but is "JSON-like", possessing the conciseness and
utility that has made JSON popular.

### Specification
[draft-newton-json-content-rules-05.txt](https://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-newton-json-content-rules-05.txt)

### Implementations
[Ruby jcrvalidator (Work in Progress)](https://github.com/arineng/jcrvalidator)  
[C++ cl-jcr-parser (Work in Progress)](https://github.com/codalogic/cl-jcr-parser)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
